items.title: Force-directed graph embedding with hops distance
items.venue: 2023 IEEE International Conference on Big Data (BigData), pp. 2946-2953
items.description: This is the first work to discuss a force-directed framework for graph embedding. In this work, all node pairs enforce attractive and repulsive forces on each other in a d-dimensional space. Larger Euclidean distance between a node pair, increases the attractive force component and decreases the repulsive one. In addition, the hop distance effect the force components. A larger hop distance, increases the coefficient of the repulsive force component, while decreases the coefficient of the attractive one.
